node.text:
Watch our second episode of “SeaLegacy: The Voyage,” a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the everyday life of photographers, filmmakers and #SonyArtisan members @mitty and @paulnicklen of @sealegacy as they continue their storytelling mission to help protect our oceans. In this episode, Cristina and Paul set sail in the Bahamas looking to create impactful images of the iconic Atlantic spotted dolphins. While dolphins are often social and playful, it turns out they are not the easiest creatures in the sea to capture on camera. Watch the full episode above and continue to tune into this series monthly for an up-close look at Paul and Cristina’s global conservation journey 🌍 🌎 🌏

New episodes every month! Be sure to stay tuned 🐬 #ShotOnSony #BeAlpha

node.title: SeaLegacy: The Voyage – Into The Pod (Ep. 2) • Shot on Sony

node.text:
Watch a sneak peek of “Skate SD”, an upcoming documentary created by @900Films, the production company of legendary skateboarder @TonyHawk. Skate SD explores the rich history of skate culture in our very own backyard – San Diego, California.  This BTS preview focuses on the integral part that skate filming has played in the history of skateboarding.  The “Skate SD” film was shot on the #SonyFX3 and #SonyFX6 and is set to be released this fall.
 
Read below for more from @900Films, the creators of “Skate SD” 🛹 #ShotOnSony
 
“Sony and skateboarding have had an incredibly long history together. When Sony came out with the VX series, skateboarders were just drawn to the camera. It was just perfect, and nearly every skateboard video for a decade and a half was shot with that series. We feel the same passion and dedication with Sony’s new lineup today... With the increased focus on competitive skateboarding this summer, people want to know about more than just the results from a contest in Tokyo. They want to know where skateboarding came from. They want to know its history. And there’s a lot more to skateboarding than just a contest. I mean, any skateboarder will tell you that. That “more” is something we want to tell.” -Jared Prindle, Executive Producer at 900Films
 
Visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more about the “Skate SD” documentary and how @900Films used Sony to capture the history and legacy of San Diego in the world of skateboarding.

node.text:
We’re excited to premiere the first episode of, “SeaLegacy: The Voyage,” a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the world of photographers, filmmakers and #SonyArtisan members @mitty and @paulnicklen of @sealegacy aboard the Sea Legacy 1 sailboat. Over the course of the next year, Paul and Cristina will be sailing around the world on a storytelling mission focused on the protection of our oceans. This series will bring you along on the front lines of the fight for conservation, ultimately demonstrating how the power of imagery can create lasting change for our planet. 🌍 🌎 🌏 

New episodes every month! Be sure to stay tuned ⛵ #ShotOnSony #BeAlpha

node.title: SeaLegacy: The Voyage - Setting Sail • Shot on Sony

node.text:
Adventure filmmakers, photographers, and #SonyArtisan members @renan_ozturk and @taylorfreesolo share a behind-the-scenes look of the process of shooting their latest @NatGeo expedition, adventuring in Guyana with the Alpha 1, #SonyAlpha a7S III and #SonyFX6. Read below to hear from Taylor and Renan about the expedition and how they went about capturing the beauty of this unexplored cloud forest in the heart of the rainforest. #ShotOnSony

“We wanted you to share with you a bit about the process of shooting a Nat Geo expedition and intense toll that it takes on the filmmakers, talent and the gear.  This footage comes from Guyana, an area beneath the towering Tepuis Mountains in this wildly beautify and unexplored Cloud Forest in the heart of the Amazon” - @taylorfreesolo

“The jungle is the ultimate testing ground for cameras. It’s not just the moisture, it’s not just the rain, it’s not just the slime — It’s the constant dropping in mud, the accidental slips, the falls, the impact all day long. It just wants to eat your camera gear alive. There were so many times I thought I destroyed a camera on this expedition, but they just kept going. I feel like we’ve reached this new stage of filmmaking with this current Sony suite. We’re able to bring back stories from the harshest places on earth and use these advanced tools to hopefully make a difference with our storytelling.” - @renan_ozturk #BeAlpha

Be sure to visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more about @renan_ozturk and @taylorfreesolo’s expedition.

node.title: “Field Notes: The Long Shot” | Shot on Sony

node.text:
Last week, we announced our new social justice initiative – CREATE ACTION, a $1 million grant program designed to aid nonprofit organizations dedicated to supporting their local communities.

Today, we’re excited to introduce @OurOwn, a nonprofit based in Los Angeles and the organization that helped inspire the #SonyCreateAction program. Just before CREATE ACTION launched, Sony donated $50,000 cash to Our Own and is collaborating with them on a $50,000 product donation as well. We also teamed up with filmmaker @jakeviramontez to create this short film that summarizes @OurOwn’s mission and goals.

Read more from the @OurOwn founders on how a program like CREATE ACTION can impact nonprofits. #ShotOnSony

“Growing up, one of the things my grandfather would always say was, ‘I am because we are.’ And because of this community, we all look out for each other, we take care of our own and we push to make sure we leave the community better than we inherited it. So it was always about community. It was always about unity, it was always about togetherness. It always came back to ‘I am because we are’. With Our Own, we're creating something that allows the next generation to thrive and be successful in whatever they to do. It starts with the children. If you can give them space to be heard and create a pipeline for them to explore what their passion is, I think you're getting the best out of them, which is in turn going to bring the best out of the community.” Dustin Young (@_youngfreshman_) & Lee Johnson (@leagueofmodern), @OurOwn Co-founders

Filmmaker Jake Viramontez shares his experience creating this short film in collaboration with @OurOwn using #SonyFX3 “Working with a such a cinematically powerful and nimble camera body allowed us to accomplish much more that we could have with any other camera setup. My goal was to create an authentic, cinematic-style film for Our Own that could help tell their story and enable their team to do more of the special things they are doing.”

Visit our LINK IN BIO 👆 for more on #SonyCreateAction. And comment and TAG your favorite nonprofit that’s making a difference in your community 👏👏

node.title: Our Own + CREATE ACTION | Shot on Sony FX3

node.text:
Introducing CREATE ACTION – a new social justice initiative designed to support non-profit organizations who provide mentorship, leadership and education to their local communities.

Through the CREATE ACTION program, Sony will select a total of 10 organizations to receive grants that include a $50,000 donation and $50,000 in Sony equipment.  Sony will also provide the grant winners a custom short film promoting the organization’s mission and efforts, and will utilize the power of their brand platform to help raise awareness.

“Sony’s main purpose is to ‘Fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology.’ CREATE ACTION is designed to support this mission. It is a program that summons the full power of Sony – including funding, product, creative resources and accessibility – to expand the impact and influence of local organizations that are creating a tremendous positive impact in their community.” -Neal Manowitz, President and COO of Sony Electronics.

Watch the full video to learn more about the program and how to apply.  TAG your favorite non-profit organization that’s making a difference in your community 👏👏 #SonyCreateAction

node.title: CREATE ACTION | A Social Justice Initiative

node.text:
Filmmaker, photographer and #SonyArtisan @chrisburkard's newest short film, “MYLO,” follows the story of Mylo Fowler (@navajomylo), who photographs the beauty of the Navajo Nation on a quest to share the story of its past and to protect its future. Watch the full film and hear from Mylo on what photography means to him 👉 " The beautiful thing about a camera is that it’s a tool that allows me to preserve my heritage and pass it on to the next generation. My hope is that my images can inspire the youth. More importantly, that they will understand that at one time our land was taken away from us. And just that story of Hwéeldi. I just have the utmost appreciation for the land that we do still have, and as we roam about, as we go about, my hope is that we are what we are supposed to be...and that’s caretakers of the land.” 🎬 #ShotOnSony #BeAlpha

Visit the LINK IN BIO to learn more. 

Credits: 
Featuring: @navajomylo 
Directed By: @chrisburkard 
Assistant Director: @benweiland

Cinematography: @benweiland, @chrisburkard, @jefftaylr & @bobcatdavis 
Drone Operator: @chrisburkard & @benweiland

Editor: @bobcatdavis

Sound Design/Mix: @scottmiddough 
3D Animation: Riley Brown 
Color: @davec9k

Production Assistants: @evanruderman & @jeffreybrundage

node.text:
Catch a sneak peek of “MYLO”, a short film by filmmaker, photographer and #SonyArtisan @chrisburkard about Navajo photographer Mylo Fowler (@navajomylo) and his passion for carrying on Navajo tradition and culture through the power of photography. Read below and visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more and stay tuned to watch this full film premiering on our Instagram (@sonyalpha) soon! #ShotOnSony 🎬 

“As we watched Mylo move through this landscape it seemed as if he knew every rock, every grain of sand. There was a connection that went much deeper than just a photographer using a camera. It was more intentional, more reverent... like a conductor guiding his symphony.” - @chrisburkard #BeAlpha

node.text:
Go behind the scenes of @sealegacy’s conservation journey starting with Timor-Leste, a young country in the coral triangle of Southeast Asia. Photographers, filmmakers, conservationists and #SonyArtisan members @mitty, @paulnicklen and @andy_mann share how impactful storytelling can make a positive impact on essential conservation efforts to protect our planet 🌍 🌎 🌏 Read below to hear more from Cristina, Paul and Andy and visit our LINK IN BIO for more! #ShotOnSony #BeAlpha

“All of the photography that we do is the cross-section of art, science and conservation. The more people know about these natural wonders, the more likely they’ll be able to see the value and be inspired to protect them.” - @paulnicklen

“Scientific research, conservation and eco-tourism have really just begun in Timor-Leste and there is incredible potential. It’s just a magical place. In the world of conservation, one photograph, one image can change everything.” -@mitty

“In our changing world, Timor-Leste's really one of the last great countries that has this level of wildlife. Conservation will only work if it works for the local people. And that’s why the stories behind the photos are so important.” -@andy_mann

Visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more. #SonyAlpha

node.title: Behind the Scenes: SeaLegacy’s Conservation Journey | Timor-Leste

node.text:
Filmmaker, #SonyArtisan, and photographer @ben_moon shares this short film that takes you through a day-in-the-life of his adventure pup, @noribythesea, as she enjoys every moment outside exploring the Oregon Coast. Watch the full film, which was captured with the #SonyAlpha a7S III and new 35mm F1.4 G Master lens (shipping next week!), and read below for more from @ben_moon to learn what inspired this piece 🐕 #ShotOnSony
 
“I hope this film allows its viewers to realize the simple joy of being immersed in the present, something our dogs embody so completely. This past year has been filled with heaviness and hardship, and I simply wanted to bring a smile to the face of whoever watches it. While I was writing my memoir Denali: A Man, a Dog, and the Friendship of a Lifetime, I sought to capture the joy life with our dogs brings us, through my relationship with my late pup Denali. In this film, I feel like Nori shares that feeling with all of us." -@ben_moon #BeAlpha
 
Visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more.

Director and cinematography: @ben_moon
Editor: @fullfroth
Original music: @israelnebeker of @blindpilot
Color grading and final post: @skiparmstrong
Sound Design: @cascadiansound
AC: @sophkuller

node.title: Nori By The Sea | Shot on the Alpha 7S III and 35mm F1.4 GM

node.text:
A collaboration with #SonyArtisan David McLain (@mclain.david) and his daughter Myla McLain (@myla.mclain) that celebrates the beauty, ruggedness and power of Coastal Maine in the winter. Film and cinematography from David, words and poem below from Myla:
•
•
I’ve grown up here
It’s all I really know
Maybe I take it for granted, I don’t know.

I am a part of this place I come from…
A place where I can run free.

The people here are capable
The coast, it makes me feel small.

I come from a place with heritage and legacy
It’s hard to really explain.

The stillness
The Boldness
They’re a part of me.

It's a different kind of world I come from.

I come from Maine.

#ShotOnSony #BeAlpha #SonyAlpha

Visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more.

node.title: “Bold Coast Dreams” | Shot on the Alpha 7S III and 35mm F1.4 GM

node.text:
Filmmaker and #SonyArtisan Michael Rubenstein (@mrubee) shares a short film about Erin Giannios, the founder and President of @bergen_county_horse_rescue, an amazing horse rescue in Mahwah, New Jersey 🐴 Watch the full video which was shot on the all-new #SonyFX3 and visit our LINK IN BIO to learn more. #ShotOnSony 🎬
• 
• 
“I used the new Sony FX3 to film this project for a number of reasons. I didn't want to bring a huge crew with me so using a small camera I could operate by myself was important. I also wanted a camera that could go from handheld to shoulder-mounted rig to a gimbal very easily and the FX3 checked all those boxes for me. The FX3 also performs really well in low light situations, films internally in 422 10bit, and shoots in the really beautiful Sony S-Cinetone color space.

Being allowed to share a person's story, in their own words, is a gift. I'm so lucky to see the world from so many different points of view and be the conduit to help others experience things they may never get to see. Telling Erin's story about the Bergen County Horse Rescue, @bergen_county_horse_recue, was especially important to me. Local heroes are the best kind of heroes. It's always good to remember you don't have to travel halfway around the world to find a good story.” -@mrubee #BeAlpha

node.title: “Rescue Horses” • Shot on the Sony FX3 and 35mm F1.4 GM

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Sony | Alpha in Glacier National Park with @maxloew. May be an image of nature and road.

node.text: Who's been to Glacier National Park? 🙋🙋‍♂️ Photographer @maxloew shares the story behind this shot 👉 "Montana is easily one of the most beautiful places I've ever visited. We found a path going between these nice flowers that were blooming, so we decided to use them in the foreground to add some depth to this lone road through the mountains. I used a mist ND filter to soften the light coming in and absolutely love how it turned out. Catching the camper van just added to the adventure vibe." #SonyAlpha a7R III • Sony 24-70mm F2.8 GM • 49mm • f/2.8 • 1/1000 sec • ISO 100 • #BeAlpha

node.text:
BEHIND THE SHOT: Swipe to hear the full story behind this photo captured of a colorful starfish among mangrove trees, taken by conservationist, photographer, and #SonyArtisan @mitty, which is part of her ongoing effort to create impactful imagery to help save our oceans and our planet 🌍 🌎 🌏 #SonyAlpha a7R IV • 12-24mm F2.8 GM • f/16 • 1/100 sec • ISO 800 • #BeAlpha

Want to know more about @mitty's conservation efforts? Visit our LINK IN BIO to catch up on our newest series "SeaLegacy: The Voyage" for a behind-the-scenes glimpse into her and @paulnicklen's world of @sealegacy as they continue their storytelling mission to help protect our oceans.

node.text:
Today's the day - #BeAlpha Live Online is here! Swipe through to explore a series from photographer #SonyArtisan and #BeAlpha Live Online Instructor @colbybrownphotography for a sneak peak of what's to come at today's event. But first, a note from Colby on creativity and some advice on growing as a photographer 🐻 "When it comes to growing as a photographer, nothing beats challenging yourself by setting outside your comfort zone. Experimenting with new genres of photography can not only help you expand your interests, but your skills as well that you can bring back to the style and kinds of photography you typically enjoy. Though that challenge comes growth as a creative!"

Be sure to visit our LINK IN BIO for all of the details on exclusive workshops, interactive live shoots, networking opportunities with other members of the #SonyAlpha community and more! What are you waiting for? We'll see you there 😎

node.text: Photographer @wildginaa share a perfect moment and a thoughtful note about the pull between creativity and doubt 🦋 “This moment was meant for me and I’m sure so many others were. But, this insect could have flown away as it moved its tiny legs while I hovered with my camera. Body uncomfortable, breath still. And, I wasn’t going to take photos that day. I was going to sit on my couch and wonder if I was any good at my craft. But, I didn’t and now, I am free.” #SonyAlpha a7R IV • Sony 90mm F2.8 GM • 90mm • f/4 • 1/400 sec • ISO 250 • #BeAlpha

node.text:
Our #BeAlpha Live Online event is this weekend! Be sure to register now to join us this Sunday (8/15) to virtually attend our event for a day filled with all things #SonyAlpha including a variety of free workshops, live shoots, community chats and more. Swipe through a series of images from #BeAlpha Live Instructor and #AlphaCollective member @stevesweatpants, who will hosting a live photoshoot and sharing his creative process for documenting people and their stories. Here's a little bit of background on Steve and what drives his passion for photography: "There’s a level of empowerment and empathy I’m always attempting to convey in my work. With life being so fleeting and living in the age of instant gratification, I find solace in the little moments that reflect that humanity is still the same but just evolved. Using my native New York intuition and perception, I hope I can tell the honest truth about society, and not be rude about it." #BeAlpha

Visit our LINK IN BIO 👆 to see the full Be Alpha Live event details and to register (for free) to save your spot!

node.text: Photographer @codyconk shares this 30 second long exposure of clouds waving through the valley near California's Mount Tamalpais 🌫️ "The rolling fog in California at Mt. Tam is one of those scenes that never gets old. This photo was taken during sunset and we were fortunate enough to get a lot of wave formations through out the valley. One of my favorite spots, and something I feel that everyone should be able to witness once in their life." #SonyAlpha a7R IV • Sony 70-200mm F2.8 GM • 130mm • f/14 • 30 sec • ISO 100 • #BeAlpha

node.text:
Watch our second episode of “SeaLegacy: The Voyage,” a behind-the-scenes glimpse into the everyday life of photographers, filmmakers and #SonyArtisan members @mitty and @paulnicklen of @sealegacy as they continue their storytelling mission to help protect our oceans. In this episode, Cristina and Paul set sail in the Bahamas looking to create impactful images of the iconic Atlantic spotted dolphins. While dolphins are often social and playful, it turns out they are not the easiest creatures in the sea to capture on camera. Watch the full episode above and continue to tune into this series monthly for an up-close look at Paul and Cristina’s global conservation journey 🌍 🌎 🌏

New episodes every month! Be sure to stay tuned 🐬 #ShotOnSony #BeAlpha

ICYMI: Our next online community event #BeAlpha Live is this Sunday and you're invited! This free event is jam-packed with learning and networking opportunities for our community including a variety of workshops, live shoots, and panels, all hosted by some of the best instructors in the industry. Swipe to explore a collection from #BeAlpha Live Instructor and #AlphaCollective member @rachel_jones_ross who will be sharing tips and tricks for astrophotography during her session this weekend ✨ "I’m so looking forward to joining the Sony family for the #BeAlpha Online event, Sunday, August 15th! It’s not only a great opportunity for me to share the joy of night photography with you all, and nerd out over cameras and lenses, it’s also a chance to reconnect with the community! I hope to see you there!" #SonyAlpha a7S III, a7R III, a1 • Sony 24-70mm F2.8 GM, Sony 12-24mm F2.8 GM, Sony 14mm F1.8 GM • #BeAlpha 

Visit our LINK IN BIO 👆 to see the full Be Alpha Live event details and to register (for free) to save your spot!

node.text:
Photographer and #SonyAlphaFemale+ grant recipient @hannahshoneycomb shares this intimate moment with one of her tiny (and very important) friends. Read more behind this shot and some small things you can do to help your friendly neighborhood bees 👉 "This is the Western honeybee, Apis mellifera, feeding from a Bidens alba flower. These flowers are often considered “weeds” where they’re found, which is a shame considering all that they do. Native wildflowers, such as these, provide food for countless pollinators and beneficial insects who play important roles in the ecosystem. Instead of a pristine and sterile lawn, consider leaving areas of your yard un-mowed, planting more flowers, and reducing pesticide usage to support pollinators from your own backyard. You’ll be rewarded with the bonus of bringing photo subjects right to you!" #SonyAlpha a6400 • Sony 30mm F3.5 Macro • f/5.6 • 1/400 sec • ISO 800 • #BeAlpha 

🐝 ICYMI: @hannahshoneycomb is also our newest @SonyAlphaFemale+ Grant winner. Bee sure to follow @hannahshoneycomb for more bee photography and about how we can support our tiny friends

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Sony | Alpha in Yorkshire with @manfredteh. May be an image of nature and tree.

node.text: How photographer @manfredteh created this moody forest shot with a #SonyAlpha a7R III and 70-200mm F2.8 GM combo 🌲 "I came across the woodland whilst on a day out driving in my local area. The woodland and area was completely desolated, quite dark and no one was around, perfect playground for photographers. I walked and wandered around that area before settling down to one of the frame you see now with tripod set up and my Sony Alpha 7R III paired with the Sony 70-200mm F2.8 GM to get the compression and depth of field going on. At the time, it just so happened I was wearing my yellow jacket and also had my portable LED light with me, so it managed to make the subject pop and stand out, contrasting nicely to the whole scenery. Always bring a portable LED light with you and also wearing something stands out. You will never know if it will ever become useful." #SonyAlpha a7R III • Sony 70-200mm F2.8 GM • 70mm • f/2.8 • 1/25 sec • ISO 500 • #BeAlpha

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Sony | Alpha on August 07, 2021 tagging @philliphallphotography. May be an image of bird and nature.

node.text: Ready to dive into the weekend? So are we 😎 Photographer @philliphallphotography shares a couple of images captured while making friends with some bright Kingfisher birds. Here's some background from Phillip on his project 👉 "Whilst trying to achieve proximity to your subject is key for beautifully sharp and detailed wildlife portraits. When trying to capture actions with very quick moments of actions like this I have learned that giving yourself a little more space is highly beneficial. To get as many shots in focus, I found the wide-tracking mode with Bird Eye AF priority to be the most effective. With this second shot, I wanted to try and show something different. Using the full resolution of the Sony Alpha 7R IV and the 600mm F4 G Master paired with the 1.4x teleconverter, we’re able to see a level of detail and intricacy in the Kingfisher’s feathers which isn’t usually seen." #SonyAlpha a1 and a7R IV • Sony 600mm F4 GM • #BeAlpha

node.text: Adventurer and photographer @mattspix84 shares how he captured Arizona’s mysterious "Keyhole Cave" using his #SonyAlpha a7R IV and 16-35mm F2.8 G Master lens set-up 👉 "I had the focal distance set at 16mm as I wanted to capture as much of the cave as I could. When I arrived at the location that night it was incredibly dark as March 13 was a new moon so the aperture was set to f/2.8. My exposure time was set to 30 seconds to gather as much light to brighten the foreground as possible. The ISO was set at 1000 with my intentions of no significant amount of noise." #SonyAlpha a7R IV • 16-35mm F2.8 G Master • 16mm • f/2.8 • 30 sec • ISO 1000 • #BeAlpha 🗝️
